<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[122, 66, 405, 85]]<|/det|> c) Wir betrachten die Funktion <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 95, 920, 114]]<|/det|> \[c(x) := 4^x - 2^x - 1. \qquad (24)\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 125, 675, 143]]<|/det|> Für die erste, zweite und dritte Ableitung von \(c\) erhalten wir <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 152, 920, 171]]<|/det|> \[c'(x) = \ln(4) \cdot 4^x - \ln(2) \cdot 2^x - 0 = 2 \ln(2) \cdot 4^x - \ln(2) \cdot 2^x \qquad (25)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 180, 920, 200]]<|/det|> \[c''(x) = 2 \ln(2) \cdot \ln(4) \cdot 4^x - \ln(2) \cdot \ln(2) \cdot 2^x = 4 \ln^2(2) \cdot 4^x - \ln^2(2) \cdot 2^x \qquad (26)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 208, 920, 228]]<|/det|> \[c''''(x) = 4 \ln^2(2) \cdot \ln(4) \cdot 4^x - \ln^2(2) \cdot \ln(2) \cdot 2^x = 8 \ln^3(2) \cdot 4^x - \ln^3(2) \cdot 2^x. \qquad (27)\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 239, 415, 257]]<|/det|> An den Wendestellen von \(c\) gilt <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[177, 266, 920, 286]]<|/det|> \[0 = c''(x) = 4 \ln^2(2) \cdot 4^x - \ln^3(2) \cdot 4^x = \ln^2(2) \cdot (4 \cdot 4^x - 2^x) \quad | : \ln^2(2) \qquad (28)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[167, 293, 920, 315]]<|/det|> \[\Leftrightarrow 0 = 4 \cdot 4^x - 2^x = 2^2 \cdot (2^2)^x - 2^x = 2^2 \cdot 2^{2x} - 2^x = 2^{2x+2} - 2^x \quad | + 2^x \qquad (29)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[167, 323, 920, 343]]<|/det|> \[\Leftrightarrow 2^x = 2^{2x+2} \qquad | \log_2(\ldots) \qquad (30)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[167, 352, 920, 371]]<|/det|> \[\Leftrightarrow x = 2x + 2 \qquad | - 2 - x. \qquad (31)\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 383, 465, 401]]<|/det|> Daraus erhalten wir die Wendestelle <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[491, 412, 920, 430]]<|/det|> \[x_1 = -2. \qquad (32)\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 441, 480, 459]]<|/det|> Durch Einsetzen finden wir die Werte <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 464, 920, 550]]<|/det|> \[c(x_1) = c(-2) = 4^{-2} - 2^{-2} - 1 = \frac{1}{16} - \frac{1}{4} - 1 = \frac{1}{16} - \frac{4}{16} - \frac{16}{16} \\ = \frac{1 - 4 - 16}{16} = -\frac{19}{16} \qquad (33)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 545, 920, 625]]<|/det|> \[c'(x_1) = c'(-2) = 2 \ln(2) \cdot 4^{-2} - \ln(2) \cdot 2^{-2} = \frac{2 \ln(2)}{16} - \frac{\ln(2)}{4} \\ = \frac{\ln(2)}{8} - \frac{2 \ln(2)}{8} = -\frac{\ln(2)}{8}. \qquad (34)\] <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 625, 920, 707]]<|/det|> \[c'''(x_1) = c''(-2) = 8 \ln^3(2) \cdot 4^{-2} - \ln^3(2) \cdot 2^{-2} = \frac{8 \ln^3(2)}{16} - \frac{\ln^3(2)}{4} \\ = \frac{2 \ln^3(2)}{4} - \frac{\ln^3(2)}{4} = \frac{\ln^3(2)}{4} > 0. \qquad (35)\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 712, 694, 730]]<|/det|> Wir stellen die Ergebnisse in der folgenden Tabelle zusammen. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[222, 739, 850, 799]]<|/det|>
k\(x_k\)\(c(x_k)\)\(c'(x_k)\)\(c''(x_k)\)\(c''''(x_k)\)Typ
1-2-19/16-\(\ln(2)/8\)0\(\ln^3(2)/4 > 0\)Wendepunkt
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[122, 810, 403, 828]]<|/det|> d) Wir betrachten die Funktion <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 839, 920, 858]]<|/det|> \[d(x) = x \cdot e^x. \qquad (37)\] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[150, 868, 675, 886]]<|/det|> Für die erste, zweite und dritte Ableitung von \(d\) erhalten wir <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 896, 920, 915]]<|/det|> \[d'(x) = 1 \cdot e^x + x \cdot e^x = (1 + x) \cdot e^x \qquad (38)\]
